title: Any Sigur Ros fans out there?
content:
Check THIS out!  
Looks amazing. CD/DVD comes out november 5th  
 [http://emichrysalis.co.uk/sigurros/heima/film/](http://web.archive.org/web/20071016223042/http:/emichrysalis.co.uk/sigurros/heima/film/ "http://emichrysalis.co.uk/sigurros/heima/film/")  
Great powerful beautiful band

 [‹ typesetting "square foot"](http://web.archive.org/web/20071016223042/http:/typophile.com/node/38005 "Go to previous forum topic") [Modern + Different Serif ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071016223042/http:/typophile.com/node/37801 "Go to next forum topic")
author: jonbruns

comments.content: Love their packaging design too. Figured I would throw that in considering this site! I believe that tyhe logo is hand written! Just trying to keep it topical!
Typophile should change the user agreement to include a $10,000 per post charge for spamming the forums and start billing the marketing firms that post this stuff.
Ha! Not spam. Just a fan. I have nothing to do with it. Just thought maybe people enjoyed the band. Sorry.

_Typophile should change the user agreement to include a $10,000 per post charge for spamming the forums and start billing the marketing firms that post this stuff._

Wet blanket. If a topic doesn’t intereste you James, or you think it’s irrelevant, ignore it, relax and have a good time.

What user agreement?

j a m e s

One could argue that the opening scene in this trailer is related to typography, therefore it is completely relevant here :)

I, for one, am <cite>very</cite> excited about this film. I have been a big fan for a few years and this documentary looks exhilarating.

Jon,

I know you’re excited, but please step away from the exclamation point.

:)
thats funny. Second post very exclamation heavy.

I won an award for this photograph of Sigur Rós. I still have the press pass stuck to my laptop.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071016223042im_/http:/typophile.com/files/sigur-ros_6450.jpg)

Their album designs almost remind me of stuff like Joy Division or Bauhaus’ first album. Very sparse and minimal, but with a kind of heaviness to them.

This movie is the only movie I’ve been looking forward to all year.
